entry.title: |News Daily|2050，亚马逊雨林将正式更名为亚马逊草原？
entry.summary: In their recent study, published in Nature on February 14, Bernardo Flores and his colleagues considered the factors contributing to the degradation of the Amazon Rainforest — climate change, drought, low rainfall, deforestation, wildfires, “edge effects” — and developed models projecting these trends into the future. The forecast is gloomy.
entry.content:
In their recent study, published in Nature on February 14, Bernardo Flores and his colleagues considered the factors contributing to the degradation of the Amazon Rainforest — climate change, drought, low rainfall, deforestation, wildfires, “edge effects” — and developed models projecting these trends into the future. The forecast is gloomy.

By 2050, the researchers found, as much as 47 percent of the Amazon Rainforest may reach a “tipping point,” at which point much of the Amazon will no longer be a rainforest at all, but a vast swathe of arid savannah and grassland. The Amazon Rainforest, Flores says, may “collapse from megafires and become trapped in a persistently flammable, open-vegetation state.” Carlos Nobre calls this “the savannization of the Amazon Rainforest.”

在 2 月 14 日发表在《自然》杂志上的最新研究中，贝尔纳多·弗洛雷斯 (Bernardo Flores) 和他的同事思考了导致亚马逊雨林退化的因素——气候变化、干旱、降雨量少、森林砍伐、野火、”边缘效应“，并开发了预测这些因素未来趋势的模型 。预测是悲观的。 研究人员估计，到 2050 年，多达 47% 的亚马逊雨林可能会达到“临界点”，届时亚马逊的大部分地区将不再是雨林，而是大片干旱的稀树草原和草地。 弗洛雷斯说，亚马逊雨林可能“因特大火灾而崩溃，并陷入持续易燃、植被开放的状态。” 卡洛斯·诺布雷称之为“亚马逊雨林的稀树草原化”。

credit source:
Septer, Quentin. “What Is the Amazon “Tipping Point,” Exactly? - the Environment - Medium.” Medium, The Environment, 24 Mar. 2024, medium.com/the-environment/what-is-the-amazon-tipping-point-exactly-9ef88eeaafca. Accessed 6 Apr. 2024.

entry.title: |News Daily| 借助手持设备，盲人可以”听“到日全食
entry.summary:
The technology, which translates the intensity of sunlight into a range of sounds, was designed to make eclipses more accessible to visually impaired people.
这项技术将太阳光照转化为一系列声音，旨在让视障人士也可以“听”到日食。
entry.content:
The technology, which translates the intensity of sunlight into a range of sounds, was designed to make eclipses more accessible to visually impaired people.
这项技术将太阳光照转化为一系列声音，旨在让视障人士也可以“听”到日食。

2024年4月8日，天象奇观日全食将出现在北美上空。当人们戴上日食眼镜抬头凝视天空时，一部分人则戴上了耳机。来自哈佛大学的研究人员开发了一种名为“lightsound”的小型设备，只要输入来太阳的光照，该设备就能根据其强度转换为不同的音乐音调。

据悉，lightsound是一项更为广泛运动的一部分。该运动旨在减小天文学对纯视觉信息的依赖。

Credit source:
Sullivan, Will. “This Handheld Device Allows Blind People to Experience the Solar Eclipse with Their Ears.” Smithsonian Magazine, Smithsonian Magazine, Apr. 2024, www.smithsonianmag.com/smart-news/this-handheld-device-allows-blind-people-to-experience-the-solar-eclipse-with-their-ears-180984062/. Accessed 2 Apr. 2024.
